description: Borrowed from Hawaiian hala, ultimately from Proto-Malayo-Polynesian *paŋdan. Doublet of pandan via Malay.

entries.meaning: Pandanus tectorius, a screw pine native to Malesia, eastern Australia, and the Pacific Islands.

adjectives.description: hala (comparative more hala, superlative most hala)

examples: Hack. Kiſs, kiſs her, Man; this Town affords ſuch every where; you'll hate the Country, when you ſee a little more; kiſs her, I ſay.  Lolp. I am ſo hala; I am aſhamed.
